4.text:
I'm Sam Robinson. I'm an advertising and lifestyle
photographer based out of London and New York.

11.text: Lucky enough to work all over the world.

14.text: We are just going to be chatting, and I'll move all the way around you.

17.text: My earliest delving into photography was through my father.

21.text:
He is a fantastic illustrator. I had no ability
to draw so I wanted to capture things, I wanted

27.text:
to create things and I had no way of doing
it, so I think out of sympathy he gave me

31.text:
a camera and since then I have always been
taking pictures.

35.text: It's my way of watching people

37.text:
and my way of getting involved and getting
to meet people and talk to people. It is amazing

42.text:
what you can do if you have a camera and you
see something you want to capture you can

45.text:
get involved with other people's lives and
just go over there and just get in the mix.

53.text:
The technical side you can probably
learn more in 6 months from the industry than

57.text:
from getting a degree, but I learned so many
life skills and different qualities from studying.

64.text:
I did a road trip across the States. Personal
work, I did a bunch of portraits called Main

68.text:
Street which I have been continuing for years.
I went back to the UK and put it together

73.text:
and send it out as a little promo piece to
see if I could get some interest.

77.text:
Within a week I got a call from a young company at
the time called Skype and they wanted to do

83.text:
a project on real people in America and how
they interact through this new format of communication,

89.text:
and so they literally send me back out and
I did three weeks back on the road again doing

92.text:
exactly the same thing as I had shot before
but for a client.

96.text: From that point forward I realised that the personal work,

100.text: the stuff you enjoy, the stuff you really put your heart into is what drives the commercial work.

106.text: Turn around, give the music to them. I have a very

110.text:
diverse client range, a lot of product, a
lot of clothing, a lot of soft drinks.

115.text:
It is so diverse. What I shoot, really, is people
and how they interact with either other people

122.text: or products. Most of my photography is even without a product.

126.text: It is just about trying to express an emotion.

129.text:
Client by client every job is
different, but we spend a lot of time in preproduction

134.text:
creating a mood and a style for that project.
What I shoot is always people. It is always

140.text:
supposed to be very natural, but they still
need to be driven by something so we create

144.text:
a mood board that we share with the creatives,
and on the day we have it to share with the

150.text:
talent and the stylist team and make sure
everyone is on the same page where that day

155.text:
is going. If I was to share some business
advice, the key is do something you love,

161.text:
take pictures of things that excite you, things
that inspire you. If you are enthusiastic

166.text:
about what you do and you love what you are
producing, inevitably other people can see

171.text:
that and get onboard. I walk into every job,
whether it is someone I have shot with a hundred

176.text:
times or it is a first day, you treat every
job like it is the most important thing you

180.text:
are doing. Focusing on what you are doing,
enjoying the time you spend on it.

184.text:
I do this because I love it so I can't love the next
job more than the one I am on now.

189.text:
Without a doubt, keeping a client is more valuable
than winning a new one.

195.text: Quite often I shoot commissions where people show me work I have shot,

199.text: and they want to recreate that for their brand.

202.text:
The trick is to keep doing your own
thing. On the back of every job, if we have

207.text:
time, we will stay for a day in a new city
and we will test. We'll get the team we have

211.text:
been working with and some new people, and
we will do something totally different to

214.text:
what we shot that week. It is about pushing
yourself all the time to do new things.

219.text: Not everything works, but you learn something from everything.
